basic_info.description: Hi, I'm Ben Mills I've spent most of my career managing a small, independent paint-your-own pottery studio in Seattle. Over the years I've spent more and more of my free time tinkering late at night with command line tools, scripts and programming languages. When an opportunity to use these hobbies came up at my last job I was so excited by the challenge and so proud of how it actually turned out that I realized software development was something I could do well and be passionate about. I enjoyed working in customer service and I see those skills I learned, of offering support and being empathetic and patient, to be a huge asset while working together on projectswith a team. Now as a software developer I'm looking for a position were I can work with people that are as curious as I am about learning how technologies work and how to solve new problems. I want to work as a creator and contribute back to the industry I've enjoyed so much as a consumer.

projects.title: SDL2 Demos
projects.description: SDL2 is a graphics library written in C. I built a series of demos in C++ to explore how this library works. Demos include basic keyboard and mouse events, rendering and image to a surface, rendering shapes, and a class to handle sprites and animated sprites.

projects.title: Code Clicker
projects.description: Code Clicker is a fun idle game with a coding theme. Users click the keyboard to generate currency that can be used to increase their lines-per-second. Inspired by Cookie Clicker. Code Clicker was built with Android Studio and features Google's Room SQLite database, SoundPool, and the Android Animation API.

projects.title: TaskMaster
projects.description: TaskMaster is an Android task managing application. Task Master features a homepage that lists all tasks, a task detail activity that includes a text-to-speech button, and a settings activity for filtering the category of task. TaskMaster stores user made tasks in an AWS Amplify database. New tasks can be created directly in the app or anywhere on the device via an image with the Android sharing menu. Accounts are controlled with Amplify Auth and the application features a sign up, verification, log in and log out activities.

projects.title: Stanza
projects.description: Stanza is a classic internet forum built with Spring MVC. Stanza features user accounts via Spring Security, admin accounts can delete posts/threads as well as add/remove admin rights. User accounts can create new threads and make posts on existing threads. Users have profile pages that display recent posts as well as allow for profile editing and avatar selection.

projects.title: Mini Arcade
projects.description: Mini Arcade is a tiny video game arcade experience with retro fun. This project was designed to be expanded on and one of the goals of the code base was to be able to make it easy to add more games. The arcade machine currently features Snake with plans for more choices coming in the future.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: I designed this website to serve for a home page for a made up cookie company specializing in salmon flavored cookies. In the fiction Pat has also asked me to also create a sales page that renders the days sales in their 5 stores around the globe. The form has an input option for adding new locations or updating existing locations.
